org.persona.middleware.context
Class ContextEvent

java.lang.Object
  org.persona.middleware.PResource
      org.persona.middleware.context.ContextEvent

public class ContextEvent
extends PResource

Instances of this class can be used to exchange info about the state of context elements using the model of RDF statements. The subject and the predicate of the RDF statement together identify a context element uniquely and the object of the RDF statement specifies its state at a time provided as a timestamp. Other properties can be used to give more info about the validity and provider of the statement, to name a few.

Author:
mtazari

          Although the accuracy of measurements can be stated in instances of (subclasses of) DimensionMeasure or MultiDimensionMeasure using org.persona.ontology.context.DimensionMeasure#errorUpperBound and / or org.persona.ontology.context.MultiDimensionMeasure#cumulativeErrorUpperBound, a general-purpose property 'hasAccuracy' can optionally be used to cover all other types of indication of the reliability of a context event in terms of a Rating.

Constant Field Values

LOCAL_NAME_CONFIDENCE

public static final String LOCAL_NAME_CONFIDENCE
The confidence of an inferred value or the probability for its correctness as an integer between 0 and 100 to indicate the probability in terms of percentage; e.g., a reasoner trying to find out what a person is doing at a point in time may provide the percentage of reliability / confidence of the reported activity based on its internal evaluation of the used indications in the inference process. Any number not in range (< 0 || > 100) should be interpreted as 'null'. Confidence is an optional property.

See Also:

public static final String LOCAL_NAME_ACCURACY
Although the accuracy of measurements can be stated in instances of (subclasses of) DimensionMeasure or MultiDimensionMeasure using org.persona.ontology.context.DimensionMeasure#errorUpperBound and / or org.persona.ontology.context.MultiDimensionMeasure#cumulativeErrorUpperBound, a general-purpose property 'hasAccuracy' can optionally be used to cover all other types of indication of the reliability of a context event in terms of a Rating.

LOCAL_NAME_PROVIDER

public static final String LOCAL_NAME_PROVIDER
The provider of the contextual info. The middleware is supposed to fill this field with the info provided by a corresponding ContextPublisher at its registration time.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

LOCAL_NAME_EXPIRATION_TIME

public static final String LOCAL_NAME_EXPIRATION_TIME
An optional property of context events is its expiration time which says until when the reported event can still be considered as valid; after that point in time the value should be considered as unknown until a new event reports a new value or confirms the old one.

When not set, values reported will remain valid until they are overridden by a more up-to-date event.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROP_CONTEXT_EXPIRATION_TIME

public static final String PROP_CONTEXT_EXPIRATION_TIME
See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOCAL_NAME_TIMESTAMP

public static final String LOCAL_NAME_TIMESTAMP
A timestamp, as a Long value to be interpreted as the number of milliseconds from 01.01.1970, will be set automatically as soon as a context provider builds an instance of ContextEvent using the ContextEvent(PResource, String) constructor. However, when the middleware constructs a context event in the course of deserializing a context event using the constructors inherited from PResource, then it can set the timestamp 'manually'.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

getPropSerializationType

public int getPropSerializationType(String propURI)
Description copied from class: PResource
Answers if the given property has to be considered when serializing this individual in a minimized way, and if not ignore-able, whether its value should be presented in its full form or can be reduced. The return value must be one of PResource.PROP_SERIALIZATION_OPTIONAL, PResource.PROP_SERIALIZATION_REDUCED, or PResource.PROP_SERIALIZATION_FULL. It can be assumed that the given property is one of those returned by PResource.getPropertyURIs(). Decision criterion should be if the value of this property is absolutely necessary when this resource is being sent to a remote node. If the subclass rates it as unlikely that the receiver side would need this info, the answer should be PROP_SERIALIZATION_OPTIONAL in favor of lower communication traffic and higher performance even at risk of a possible additional query on the receiver side for fetching this info. With the same rationale, if a property should be included in the process of serialization, it is preferable to include it in a reduced form; in this case the return value should be PROP_SERIALIZATION_REDUCED, otherwise PROP_SERIALIZATION_FULL can be returned. Subclasses should normally overwrite this method as this default implementation returns always PROP_SERIALIZATION_UNDEFINED.

Overrides:
getPropSerializationType in class PResource

Subclasses should overwrite this methods as the default implementation returns always true.

setProperty

public void setProperty(String propURI,
                        Object value)
Description copied from class: PResource
Adds a statement with this resource as the subject, the given propURI as the predicate and the given value as the object. Subclasses must override this in order to decide if the statement to be added fits the general class constraints. If not, the call of this method should be ignored. For each property only one single call may be made to this method, unless subsequent calls to this method for setting the value of the same property are treated as an update for an update-able property. Multi-valued properties must be set using an instance of List. The differentiation, if a such list should be treated as an rdf:List, can be made with the help of PResource.isClosedCollection(String). The default implementation here accepts all property-value pairs blindly except for rdf:type which is handled if the value is a type URI, a PResource or a java.util.List of them.

Note: The setting of the property rdf:type is being handled by this class via the final methods PResource.addType(String, boolean), PResource.getType(), and PResource.getTypes(). Although these methods give the view of handling type URIs as strings, but in reality the types are stored as direct instances of this class. So, the subclasses should ignore calls for setting rdf:type; if not, then the subclass must pay attention that the value should be a List of direct instances of this class so that (1) the PResource.toString() method returns just the URI and (2) the serializers get no problems with the value. Also, settings via subclasses may be overwritten by this class if a subsequent call to PResource.addType(String, boolean) is made.

Overrides:
setProperty in class PResource
